article.title: Crop Planning using Stochastic Visual Optimization

multiple_choice_question.text: What does clicking on a variety name in the "Top Growing Varieties" list do on the ViSeed visualization?
choices: Highlights the sub-regions on the map where that variety has the highest yield.
Displays a detailed report of the weather and soil conditions for that variety.
Highlights the sub-regions on the map where that variety is part of the optimal solution.
Shows the historical yield data for that variety across all sub-regions.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 3, what information is displayed after clicking on a specific sub-region?
choices: The average yield and spatial cohesion score for the entire region.
The top k varieties for that sub-region, their weights in the optimal solution, and predicted yield distribution.
A list of all varieties and their respective yields for that sub-region.
A comparison of weather and soil conditions between the selected sub-region and the entire region.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 5 illustrates the concept of a "Common Solution." What does this refer to in the context of the research?
choices: A solution where all sub-regions grow the same single, most productive soybean variety.
A solution based solely on maximizing yield, disregarding variability across sub-regions.
A single optimal combination of up to five soybean varieties for the entire region.
A solution that prioritizes sub-regions with the highest spatial cohesion scores.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 7 shows the impact of changing variability thresholds. What is the general trend observed as the variability threshold increases?
choices: Both average yield and spatial cohesion score decrease, leading to less desirable solutions.
Average yield increases, while spatial cohesion score decreases, indicating a trade-off between the two.
Both average yield and spatial cohesion score generally increase, leading to more robust solutions.
Average yield decreases, while spatial cohesion score increases, highlighting the importance of regional similarity.
